<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=633) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=323" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=166" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 100 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 209 <sup>4.0</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 198 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Trigger**
A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared.

**Requirements**
[Sorcerer] You have an unexpended spell slot you could use to cast the triggering spell.

</column>

---

When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to counter it.

**[Witch, Wizard]** You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the triggering spell.

**[Sorcerer]** You expend one of your spell slots to counter the triggering creature’s casting of a spell that you have in your repertoire. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell.

**Special** [Sorcerer] This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

<title level="2">Counterspell leads to...</title>
[Clever Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=653), [Consume Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=1827), [Reflect Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=624), [School Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=3026), [School Spell Redirection](/Feats.aspx?ID=3027)
